name: groovy-spock-support
description: Language support for Groovy and Spock

groovy.java.home.description: Specifies the folder path to the JDK. Use this setting if the extension cannot find Java automatically.

groovy.java.vmargs.description: Extra JVM arguments for the Groovy language server (e.g. "-Xmx2g"). When unset, heap is auto-sized (512 MBâ€“4 GB) based on workspace size, G1GC is enabled, and HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError is set.

groovy.classpath.description: Specifies additional entries to add to the classpath. May contain both folders and individual .jar files.

groovy.debug.serverPort.description: If set, connect to an existing Groovy LSP server on this TCP port instead of starting one automatically.

groovy.logLevel.description: Set the log level for the Groovy language server. Lower levels produce more output. Changing this restarts the server.

groovy.showMemoryUsage.description: Show the language server's JVM memory usage in the status bar next to "Groovy".

groovy.semanticHighlighting.enabled.description: Enable or disable semantic syntax highlighting for Groovy files.

groovy.formatting.enabled.description: Enable or disable document formatting for Groovy files.

groovy.maven.home.description: Specifies the folder path to the Maven installation. Use this if mvn is not on your PATH.

groovy.project.importers.description: Limit which build-tool importers are active during project discovery. Valid values: "Gradle", "Maven". An empty array (default) enables all importers. Set to ["Gradle"] to skip Maven discovery entirely, or ["Maven"] to skip Gradle.

groovy.memory.scopeEvictionTTL.description: Time in seconds after which an inactive project scope's heavy state (AST, classloader, compilation unit) is evicted from memory. The scope is transparently reactivated on the next request. Set to 0 to disable eviction. Useful for large multi-project workspaces.

groovy.memory.backfillSiblingProjects.description: When true, opening a file in one Gradle subproject automatically resolves classpaths for all sibling subprojects in the background. This improves cross-project navigation but increases memory usage. When false (default), each project's classpath is resolved on demand when you first open a file in it.

groovy.memory.perProjectMB.description: Memory (in MB) allocated per project when auto-sizing the heap. With scope eviction enabled (default), up to 8 active projects use this allocation. Without eviction, all discovered projects count. Default: 128 MB.

groovy.memory.pressureThreshold.description: Heap usage percentage at which the language server triggers emergency scope eviction. When the JVM heap exceeds this threshold, the least-recently-used inactive scope is evicted immediately regardless of the TTL timer. Lower values are more aggressive (evict sooner). Default: 75%.
